seg-source.mrk: The cathedral borders the main plaza of the old and well-preserved city.

alt-trans.source: The cathedral borders the main plaza of the old and well-preserved city.
alt-trans.target: La catedral bordea la plaza principal de la antigua y bien conservada ciudad

trans-unit.source: The cathedral borders the main plaza of the old and well-preserved city. Legend has it that the remains of the apostle James were brought to Galicia for burial. In 813, according to medieval legend, the light of a bright star guided a shepherd who was watching his flock at night to the burial site in Santiago de Compostela. The shepherd quickly reported his discovery to the bishop of Iria, Bishop Teodomiro.The bishop declared that the remains were those of the apostle James and immediately notified King Alfonso II in Oviedo. To honour St. James, the cathedral was built on the spot where his remains were said to have been found. The legend, which included numerous miraculous events, enabled the Catholic faithful to not only maintain their stronghold in northern Spain during the Christian crusades against the Moors, but also led to the growth and development of the city.

seg-source.mrk: Legend has it that the remains of the apostle James were brought to Galicia for burial.
In 813, according to medieval legend, the light of a bright star guided a shepherd who was watching his flock at night to the burial site in Santiago de Compostela.

The shepherd quickly reported his discovery to the bishop of Iria, Bishop Teodomiro.The bishop declared that the remains were those of the apostle James and immediately notified King Alfonso II in Oviedo.
To honour St. James, the cathedral was built on the spot where his remains were said to have been found.

The legend, which included numerous miraculous events, enabled the Catholic faithful to not only maintain their stronghold in northern Spain during the Christian crusades against the Moors, but also led to the growth and development of the city.

target.mrk: En 813, según la leyenda medieval, a la luz de una estrella brillante guió a un pastor que estaba observando a su rebaño durante la noche a la tumba de Santiago de Compostela.

El pastor informó rápidamente su descubrimiento al obispo de Iria, el obispo Teodomiro. El obispo declaró que los restos eran los del apóstol Santiago y de inmediato notificó el rey Alfonso II de Oviedo.
En honor a Santiago, la catedral fue construida en el lugar donde se dice que sus restos han sido encontrados.

La leyenda, que incluyó numerosos eventos milagrosos, permitió a los fieles católicos, no sólo para mantener su fortaleza en el norte de España durante las cruzadas cristianas contra los moros, sino que también condujo al crecimiento y desarrollo de la ciudad.

alt-trans.source: To honour St. James, the cathedral was built on the spot where his remains were said to have been found.
alt-trans.target: En honor a Santiago, la catedral fue construida en el lugar donde se dice que sus restos habían sido encontrados.

alt-trans.source: The legend, which included numerous miraculous events, enabled the Catholic faithful to not only maintain their stronghold in northern Spain during the Christian crusades against the Moors, but also led to the growth and development of the city.
alt-trans.target: La leyenda, que incluyó numerosos eventos milagrosos, permitió a la fé católica, no sólo mantener su fortaleza en el norte de España durante las cruzadas cristianas contra los moros, sino que también condujo al crecimiento y desarrollo de la ciudad.

alt-trans.source: The legend, which included numerous miraculous events, enabled the Catholic faithful to not only maintain their stronghold in northern Spain during the Christian crusades against the Moors, but also led to the growth and development of the city.
alt-trans.target: La leyenda, que incluyó numerosos eventos milagrosos, permitió a la fé católicos, no sólo mantener su fortaleza en el norte de España durante las cruzadas cristianas contra los moros, sino que también condujo al crecimiento y desarrollo de la ciudad.

trans-unit.source: Santiago is the site of the University of Santiago de Compostela, established in the early 16th century. The main campus can be seen best from an alcove in the large municipal park in the centre of the city.

seg-source.mrk: Santiago is the site of the University of Santiago de Compostela, established in the early 16th century.
The main campus can be seen best from an alcove in the large municipal park in the centre of the city.

target.mrk: Santiago es la sede de the University of Santiago de Compostela, fundada en el siglo 16.

alt-trans.source: The main campus can be seen best from an alcove in the large municipal park in the centre of the city.
alt-trans.target: El campus principal se puede ver mejor en un nicho en el gran parque municipal en el centro de la ciudad.

trans-unit.source: Within the old town there are many narrow winding streets full of historic buildings. The new town all around it has less character though some of the older parts of the new town have some big flats in them.

seg-source.mrk: Within the old town there are many narrow winding streets full of historic buildings.
The new town all around it has less character though some of the older parts of the new town have some big flats in them.

target.mrk: En el casco antiguo hay muchas calles estrechas y sinuosas llenas de edificios históricos.

alt-trans.source: The new town all around it has less character though some of the older parts of the new town have some big flats in them
alt-trans.target: La nueva ciudad a su alrededor es menos llamativa que algunas de las partes más antiguas de esta ciudad alberga algunos grandes pisos.

alt-trans.source: The new town all around it has less character though some of the older parts of the new town have some big flats in them
alt-trans.target: La ciudad nueva a su alrededor tiene menos carácter que algunas de las partes más antiguas de la ciudad nueva tiene algunos grandes pisos en ellos.

trans-unit.source: Santiago de Compostela has a substantial nightlife. Divided between the new town (a zona nova in Galician, la zona nueva in Spanish or ensanche) and the old town (a zona vella in Galician or la zona vieja in Spanish, trade-branded as zona monumental), a mix of middle-aged residents and younger students running throughout the city until the early hours of the morning can often be found. Radiating from the centre of the city, the historic cathedral is surrounded by paved granite streets, tucked away in the old town, and separated from the newer part of the city by the largest of many parks throughout the city, Parque da Alameda. Whether in the old town or the new town, party-goers will often find themselves following their tapas by dancing the night away.

seg-source.mrk: Santiago de Compostela has a substantial nightlife.

Divided between the new town (a zona nova in Galician, la zona nueva in Spanish or ensanche) and the old town (a zona vella in Galician or la zona vieja in Spanish, trade-branded as zona monumental), a mix of middle-aged residents and younger students running throughout the city until the early hours of the morning can often be found.

Radiating from the centre of the city, the historic cathedral is surrounded by paved granite streets, tucked away in the old town, and separated from the newer part of the city by the largest of many parks throughout the city, Parque da Alameda.
Whether in the old town or the new town, party-goers will often find themselves following their tapas by dancing the night away.

target.mrk: Santiago de Compostela tiene una vida nocturna muy importante.

Dividido entre la ciudad nueva (una zona nova en Galicia , la zona nueva en español o ensanche) y el casco antiguo (una zona vieja en gallego o la zona vieja, en español , el comercio con la marca de zona monumental), una mezcla de medios residentes ancianos y jóvenes estudiantes corriendo por toda la ciudad hasta las primeras horas de la mañana, a menudo se pueden encontrar.

Irradiando desde el centro de la ciudad, la histórica catedral está rodeada de calles pavimentadas de granito, escondido en el casco antiguo, y se separa de la parte nueva de la ciudad por el mayor de los muchos parques en toda la ciudad, Parque de la Alameda.

trans-unit.source: The population of the city in 2012 was 95,671 inhabitants, while the metropolitan area reaches 178,695. In 2010 there were 4,111 foreigners living in the city, representing a 4,3% of the total population. The main nationalities are Brazilians (11%), Portuguese (8%) and Colombians (7%). By language, according to 2008 data, 21% of the population always speak in Galician, 15% always speak in Spanish and the rest use both interchangeably.

seg-source.mrk: The population of the city in 2012 was 95,671 inhabitants, while the metropolitan area reaches 178,695.
In 2010 there were 4,111 foreigners living in the city, representing a 4,3% of the total population.
The main nationalities are Brazilians (11%), Portuguese (8%) and Colombians (7%).
By language, according to 2008 data, 21% of the population always speak in Galician, 15% always speak in Spanish and the rest use both interchangeably.

target.mrk: La población de la ciudad en 2012 fue de 95.671 habitantes, mientras que el área metropolitana llega a 178.695.
En 2010 había 4.111 extranjeros que viven en la ciudad, lo que representa un 4,3% de la población total.
Las principales nacionalidades son brasileños (11%), Portugal (8%) y colombianos (7%).
By language, according to 2008 data, 21% of the population always speak in Galician, 15% always speak in Spanish and the rest use both interchangeably.
